member.name: T:Weswen.NotGeneratedAttribute
member.summary: Describes that this property / field is not filled by the .

member.name: T:Weswen.TableCellAttribute
member.summary: Defines that this property is a cell in a Word Document table.

member.name: M:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Defines a cell in the table.
member.param: Row position in the table. Minimum: 1.
Column position in the table. Minimum: 1.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.AddNewLinesPerParagraph
member.summary: Once the paragraphs are being read, should the be appended at the end of the paragraph?

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.MaxRowCharacters
member.summary: Defines how many characters can this cell take before splitting into multiple paragraphs. Needs to be at least 1 for this feature to be included.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Content
member.summary: Optional property for setting the already known content. If this is null, property's value is used.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Paragraphs
member.summary: Collection of strings in case the content needs to be split into multiple paragraphs.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.NumParagraphs
member.summary: Number of paragraphs to have in this cell no mather what. Needs to be at least 1 for this feature to be included.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.NumParagraphsExceptions
member.summary: Strings that will affect the . For example, by default, "\n" will be in here, so if is 5 and there are 2 "\n"'s found, only 3 blank paragraphs will be added.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Format
member.summary: Allows insertion of the content at the desired location. Example: "${0}", {0} will be replaced by the content (of or property value).

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.PropertyValueOverAttributeValue
member.summary: Should the value of the property be used if it is available even if the is defined?

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Row
member.summary: Row position in the table.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.RowIndex
member.summary: Row position in the table by index.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Column
member.summary: Column position in the table.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.ColumnIndex
member.summary: Column position in the table by index.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.RowSpan
member.summary: How many rows this cell takes (merges with). Minimum: 1.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.RowSpanEnd
member.summary: Gets the end position for the row span.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.ColumnSpan
member.summary: How many columns this cell takes (merges with). Minimum: 1.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.ColumnSpanEnd
member.summary: Gets the end position for the column span.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.TextSize
member.summary: Size of the content inside the cell.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.Bold
member.summary: Should the text be bold?

member.name: P:Weswen.TableCellAttribute.TextSpacing
member.summary: Spacing between the characters of the cell content.

member.summary: Checks if the content in the cell should wrap.

member.summary: Checks if the given object equals the current one.

member.summary: Default hash function.

member.summary: Defines a table in the Word Document.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.NumRows
member.summary: Number of rows that the table will have.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.NumColumns
member.summary: Number of columns that the table will have.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.ColumnWidths
member.summary: Widths of the columns.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.Alignment
member.summary: Defines the alignment of the table.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.NumParagraphsAfter
member.summary: How many paragraphs should be added after the table.

member.name: P:Weswen.TableModelAttribute.PageBreakAfter
member.summary: If there are multiple tables, after how many tables should there be a page break? Needs to be at least 1 for this feature to be included.

member.name: F:Weswen.BaseSeparatorConverter`1._propertyValidator
member.summary: Validator (filter) used while getting the properties. If this returns false, property is skipped. If this is null, none of the properties are skipped.

member.summary: Separator used for separating items in a line.

member.summary: Converts the given line separated by into the item of type . By default, splits by the and stores values in properties.
member.param: Line to convert into an item of type .

member.name: M:Weswen.Utils.TraverseThroughObjectsHierarchy(System.Object,System.Func{Weswen.TraversionInfo,System.Boolean},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Reflection.BindingFlags)
member.summary: Traverses through the object's hierarchy and provides information about each in the hierarchy as it goes through it.
member.param: Object to traverse.

param.name: objectChanged
param.para: Method that gets called every time a new object in the hierarchy is being processed.
If it returns true, the recursion will occur.

There are specific cases where the return value won't matter: call on the root element (because it always has to go into recursion) and when the prield's value cannot be read because its parent is null.

member.param: Should the backing fields of properties be skipped or not?
Should there be iteration through prield's children if its value is null?
used for accessing the fields and properties.

member.name: T:Weswen.CollectionInfo
member.summary: Information about a type - is it a collection and if it is, which types does that collection work with?

member.name: P:Weswen.CollectionInfo.IsCollection
member.summary:
Defines if the passed in type is IEnumerable (if it implements ).
(Arrays also implement ).

member.name: P:Weswen.CollectionInfo.IsArray
member.summary: Defines if the passed in type is an array.

member.name: P:Weswen.CollectionInfo.ArrayType
member.summary:
If the passed in type is an array, this will be the type of that array.
For example, if the passed in type is of type int[], this collection will contain the type int.

member.name: P:Weswen.CollectionInfo.CollectionTypes
member.summary:
If the passed in type is an IEnumerable, this will be the collection of types for that IEnumerable.
For example, if the passed in type is of type Dictionary<int, string>, this collection will contain types int and string.

member.name: M:Weswen.CollectionInfo.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Provides information about a type.
member.param: Type to test if it is a collection.

member.name: T:Weswen.Generator
member.summary: Used to generate data (usually random) for fields and properties.

member.name: P:Weswen.Generator.Instance
member.summary: Singleton instance of this class.

member.name: P:Weswen.Generator.InitializeHierarchy
member.summary:
Defines when should the generator go through the object's hierarchy and initialize all of the objects found in it.
By default, hierarchy won't be initialized if the object's type is primitive, a collection, or one of the following types: , ,
If this is set to null, hierarchy will be always initialized.

member.name: P:Weswen.Generator.SkipBackingFields
member.summary: Defines if the generator should skip the backing fields while generating values. This means that properties that don't have set method can still be randomly generated.
